title: 'Biden stumbles, Trump lies': How the global media reacted to the presidential debate
content: President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump went head-to-head in their first debate — and the world's media was watching.
summary: President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump went head-to-head in their first debate — and the world's media was watching.

title: France's far right looks headed for victory in the first round at the polls. Here's what that means
content: With just days to go until France's snap parliamentary election kicks off, victory for the far right looks increasingly likely in the first phase of the two-stage runoff.
summary: With just days to go until France's snap parliamentary election kicks off, victory for the far right looks increasingly likely in the first phase of the two-stage runoff.

title: Fed and European Central Bank could cut interest rates in September, Morgan Stanley strategist says
content: The U.S. Federal Reserve and European Central Bank could move to cut rates in September, a Morgan Stanley strategist said Friday.
summary: The U.S. Federal Reserve and European Central Bank could move to cut rates in September, a Morgan Stanley strategist said Friday.

title: Apple's Vision Pro starts deliveries at a higher price in China than in the U.S.
content: Apple's mixed-reality headset began deliveries in China on Friday with a retail price 18% higher than in the U.S.
summary: Apple's mixed-reality headset began deliveries in China on Friday with a retail price 18% higher than in the U.S.

title: Specter of Putin casts a shadow over the Trump-Biden debate
content: Russian leader Vladimir Putin was invoked roughly a dozen times in the 90-minute debate between President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump.
summary: Russian leader Vladimir Putin was invoked roughly a dozen times in the 90-minute debate between President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump.

title: Key Fed measure shows inflation rose 2.6% in May from a year ago, as expected
content: The core personal consumption expenditures price index was expected to increase 0.1% in May and 2.6% from a year ago.
summary: The core personal consumption expenditures price index was expected to increase 0.1% in May and 2.6% from a year ago.

title: 'Alarmingly high': E.coli levels discovered in River Thames ahead of famous regatta
content: Harmful E.coli bacteria has been discovered in the U.K.'s River Thames just days before elite rowers are due to compete for the international Henley Regatta.
summary: Harmful E.coli bacteria has been discovered in the U.K.'s River Thames just days before elite rowers are due to compete for the international Henley Regatta.

title: Here are the 10 most livable cities in the world — and Europe dominates the list
content: Vienna, Copenhagen and Zurich topped the list for the most livable cities in the world, according to EIU's 2024 Global Liveability Index.
summary: Vienna, Copenhagen and Zurich topped the list for the most livable cities in the world, according to EIU's 2024 Global Liveability Index.

title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: The humble onion could be holding India's economy hostage
content: Even a modest change in the price of the bulbous vegetable soon becomes the talking point around dinner tables for hundreds of millions of people in the country.
summary: Even a modest change in the price of the bulbous vegetable soon becomes the talking point around dinner tables for hundreds of millions of people in the country.

title: SoftBank shares rise on $1.86 billion debt offering as CEO talks up 'super' AI

title: European stocks move lower as investors digest fresh inflation data
content: European stocks moved lower Friday afternoon as investors digest key inflation data from the euro zone.

title: India's major bond market milestone could prove to be a double-edged sword for investors
content: Anticipating the Wall Street bank's decision, markets have partly pushed up bond prices this year despite risks of inflation reigniting.

title: Japanese yen weakens to fresh 38-year lows; top currency diplomat replaced

title: Iran votes for its new president amid economic strife, crackdowns and regional war
content: If there is no clear majority after Friday's vote, the top two candidates face a second round of voting on July 5.

title: Younger generations of Asians are spending big on art
content: More than 40% of Sotheby's contemporary art buyers in Asia are millennials. While the size of the global art market fell last year, sales in China were up 9%.
summary: More than 40% of Sotheby's contemporary art buyers in Asia are millennials. While the size of the global art market fell last year, sales in China were up 9%.

title: India set to see billions in inflows as government bonds debut on JPMorgan's debt index
content: While the inclusion of the bonds into the JPMorgan index has been priced in already, PGIM sees a positive longer-term impact.
summary: While the inclusion of the bonds into the JPMorgan index has been priced in already, PGIM sees a positive longer-term impact.

title: Forget to-do lists. Here are 4 tips on how to stop procrastinating
content: In a world that is increasingly distractible, learning how to harness our attention is the "skill of the century," says best-selling author Nir Eyal.

title: China is testing the limits of a critical U.S.-Philippines defense pact — will Washington respond?
content: China has stepped up its actions against the Philippines in disputed waters of the South China Sea, raising questions of American deterrence in the region.

title: Chinese smartphone maker Honor says AI's power is 'worthless' without data privacy
content: The transforming power of artificial intelligence is of no value unless user data is protected, says the CEO of Chinese smartphone company Honor, George Zhao.
summary: The transforming power of artificial intelligence is of no value unless user data is protected, says the CEO of Chinese smartphone company Honor, George Zhao.

title: Nike shares plunge after retailer says quarterly sales will fall 10%, warns on China weakness
content: Nike has found itself in a rough patch as the sneaker giant has worked to claw back market share it's ceded to upstarts like On Running and Hoka.
summary: Nike has found itself in a rough patch as the sneaker giant has worked to claw back market share it's ceded to upstarts like On Running and Hoka.

title: Onboard forests, street markets and reefs: Disney releases details about its new cruise in Singapore
content: The Disney Adventure will sail three- and four-night voyages from Singapore starting in 2025, with the capacity to carry some 6,700 passengers on board.
summary: The Disney Adventure will sail three- and four-night voyages from Singapore starting in 2025, with the capacity to carry some 6,700 passengers on board.

title: IMF says Fed should hold interest rates where they are until 'at least' end of year
content: IMF managing director Kristalina Georgieva said Thursday that the Federal Reserve should hold off on rate cuts until 'at least' the second half of the year.

content: Chinese automakers are expected to continue rapidly expanding outside of China to achieve 33% of the global automotive market share by 2030.

title: JPMorgan Chase says its stress test losses should be higher than what the Fed disclosed

title: In a new round of 'panda diplomacy,' China sends giant bears to the U.S. after two decades
content: After 21 years, giant pandas are en route from China to the U.S. — a sign that Beijing is resuming its "panda diplomacy" efforts as relations with the West thaw.

title: Rivian investor day focuses on cost reductions, efficiencies and next-generation EVs

title: Chewy stock pops 34% after Roaring Kitty posts a dog picture, then gives it all back
